p: During the glycation of proteins, temperature, time, nature, and concentration of the reactions, as well as pH and water activity ( a w), should be controlled in order to be able to influence the yield, quality, and techno-functionality of glycated proteins, and to limit color and off-flavor formation to a minimum [ 12, 85]. A schematic overview of the influence of different environmental parameters on the reaction rate of the Maillard reaction is presented in Figure 3.
